channel.title: What windows operating system is best
channel.description: this is just a survey or however u spell that. i wanna know peoples opinions on computer operating systems

item.title: What windows operating system is best
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:49, topic:257466”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=339911.msg2683403#msg2683403 date=1235518218]
Yes, 32-Bit OS’s support 2GB of RAM and possibly max out at ~3GB. If you have a multi-core processor, use a 64-bit OS as it is the future… Preferably a Linux distribution.
[/quote]
64 bit has been around for decades, Windows only took up on it in the last 4 years. :P[/quote]

Yes, I understand that ; but 64Bit architecture hit public recently (5 years or so).

Read full topic
item.source: What windows operating system is best

item.title: What windows operating system is best
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

T4_:

Yes, 32-Bit OS’s support 2GB of RAM and possibly max out at ~3GB. If you have a multi-core processor, use a 64-bit OS as it is the future… Preferably a Linux distribution.

64 bit has been around for decades, Windows only took up on it in the last 4 years.

Read full topic
item.source: What windows operating system is best

item.title: What windows operating system is best
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Cruzer, post:47, topic:257466”][quote author=WhiteShadow link=topic=339911.msg2682283#msg2682283 date=1235439450]

I’m currently very frustrated with Windows Vista 64 bit… & downloading ubuntu iso.

I use to always use Windows XP and so I decided to give Vista a try (it’s been 2 yrs since it’s release?) and damn
it fucking sucks.

It comes with like 100+ services and a bunch of other stupid shit.

The search file sucks and I have to download a special 64 bit windows for specific programs… blah it’s retarded.

you obviously had no reason to install a 64-bit os then

Came with the laptop. :\

so then you bought a laptop , knowing that it has a 64-bit os?

Yes.

I don’t even think you can get 4 gb of ram with 32 bit???
[/quote]3.5 i think[/quote]

Yes, 32-Bit OS’s support 2GB of RAM and possibly max out at ~3GB. If you have a multi-core processor, use a 64-bit OS as it is the future… Preferably a Linux distribution.

Read full topic
item.source: What windows operating system is best

item.description:

[/quote]

In my experience installing XP gives you 0 programs, besides calculator, notepad, wordpad and solitaire.[/quote]

Sometimes company’s like Packard Bell put trial shit on it which can’t fail to irritate me to high levels.
